description: Adobe Dreamweaver Creative Cloud is used by web designers and front-end developers and allows you to visualize your site in real-time as you code. Its design surface combines with integration of Bootstrap and code editor and integrates robust site management tools for easy design, code, and management of websites and mobile content. This course covers exam objectives for the Adobe Certified Associate (ACA) certification.
name: Dreamweaver CC
subtitle: Web Design Application

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss the basics of DreamWeaver. They explain preferences, the Welcome screen, history and customizing the Workspace. They look at panels including docking, collapsing, groups and creating new layouts.
episodes.title: Introduction to Dreamweaver
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.065 --> 00:00:14.981
Welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITProTV.

3
00:00:14.981 --> 00:00:19.423
I'm your host, Wes Bryan, and in today's
episode we're moving into the world of

4
00:00:19.423 --> 00:00:22.611
Dreamweaver, that's right,
creative cloud 2015.

5
00:00:22.611 --> 00:00:26.450
And joining me in the studios today to
lend his expertise in this very endeavor

6
00:00:26.450 --> 00:00:27.870
is none other than Mr. Jim Searles.

7
00:00:27.870 --> 00:00:29.200
Jim, how you doing today, Sir?

8
00:00:29.200 --> 00:00:31.287
>> I'm doing great, Wes,
thank you for having me today.

9
00:00:31.287 --> 00:00:34.113
I'd also like to thank ITProTV for
allowing me to come in and

10
00:00:34.113 --> 00:00:38.120
talk about these applications that
I love so much and that I use.

11
00:00:38.120 --> 00:00:40.590
And I'd like to specifically
talk about Dreamweaver and

12
00:00:40.590 --> 00:00:44.770
how the tools within the application
are intuitive enough to help you build

13
00:00:44.770 --> 00:00:49.380
a webpage from never having
done anything from scratch.

14
00:00:49.380 --> 00:00:51.658
>> Very good.
So anytime we dive into a product or

15
00:00:51.658 --> 00:00:55.759
a technology, we typically have some
basics that we have to go over and Jim,

16
00:00:55.759 --> 00:00:59.949
you're gonna introduce us to this topic
and show us some of the fundamental.

17
00:00:59.949 --> 00:01:02.560
>> That's a very good question,
Wes, and a very good point.

18
00:01:02.560 --> 00:01:06.150
We're gonna start by talking about
the basics, specifically in this session.

19
00:01:06.150 --> 00:01:08.559
And we're gonna learn
about the interface and

20
00:01:08.559 --> 00:01:12.640
then work our way on through the HTML
coding as well as the CSS coding.

21
00:01:12.640 --> 00:01:16.790
So at this point, I'd like to
draw attention to my screen, and

22
00:01:16.790 --> 00:01:20.550
we'll talk about the Welcome
screen within the Adobe platform.

23
00:01:20.550 --> 00:01:25.073
Now, this is one of the few applications
that Adobe uses the Welcome screen.

24
00:01:25.073 --> 00:01:29.655
And I find it to be one of the few
applications that is extremely useful

25
00:01:29.655 --> 00:01:30.500
to use.

26
00:01:30.500 --> 00:01:33.490
The other applications that we've used for

27
00:01:33.490 --> 00:01:36.460
Adobe don't always facilitate
this Welcome screen, but

28
00:01:36.460 --> 00:01:40.710
here it's essential because of the fact
that we have the ability to create our new

29
00:01:40.710 --> 00:01:45.180
files right here in the center and start
from a template that Adobe is aware of.

30
00:01:45.180 --> 00:01:47.100
So we'll talk about the welcome screen.

31
00:01:47.100 --> 00:01:48.490
We'll talk about some preferences.

32
00:01:48.490 --> 00:01:50.360
We're gonna talk about the layout.

33
00:01:50.360 --> 00:01:53.040
And I'm also gonna show you
the differences between

34
00:01:53.040 --> 00:01:56.420
what's available on the Mac and
what's available on the PC,

35
00:01:56.420 --> 00:01:59.870
because those are gonna be very important
within the Dreamweaver application.

36
00:01:59.870 --> 00:02:04.980
So when I look at the welcome
screen within the platform,

37
00:02:04.980 --> 00:02:07.330
there are three columns of information.

38
00:02:07.330 --> 00:02:09.900
Basically, if you've been
working with files in the past,

39
00:02:09.900 --> 00:02:12.090
you'll see the ability to
go back to those files.

40
00:02:12.090 --> 00:02:13.770
So you've got your recent files here.

41
00:02:13.770 --> 00:02:16.500
You can also start from scratch and
open a new file.

42
00:02:16.500 --> 00:02:20.600
But here, in the center, we have
the ability to create from a template.

43
00:02:20.600 --> 00:02:23.340
And it's gonna give you the coding
structure that you need based on

44
00:02:23.340 --> 00:02:24.110
that template.

45
00:02:24.110 --> 00:02:27.384
So we have some CSS files, HTML, PHP, XML.

46
00:02:27.384 --> 00:02:30.334
And we'll talk a little bit about
those items later on as we get through

47
00:02:30.334 --> 00:02:31.410
this process.

48
00:02:31.410 --> 00:02:37.450
We also have some new fluid
designs down here at the bottom.

49
00:02:37.450 --> 00:02:40.950
And those designs are basically set up so
that way they are gonna be responsive to

50
00:02:40.950 --> 00:02:45.660
whatever device the person comes to your
site on, and that will be important.

51
00:02:45.660 --> 00:02:49.070
And then, lastly,
the third column is the ability to learn

52
00:02:49.070 --> 00:02:54.220
from Adobe what is the latest, greatest
thing happening within this application.

53
00:02:54.220 --> 00:02:57.940
So we have some links here that will take
you back out to Adobe TV in some cases,

54
00:02:57.940 --> 00:03:01.310
or adobe.com,
which will provide you that information.

55
00:03:01.310 --> 00:03:04.910
So what I'd like to do right now, however,
is I'd like to start you from scratch.

56
00:03:04.910 --> 00:03:09.300
We're just gonna click on this HTML link
and we'll create a document from scratch.

57
00:03:09.300 --> 00:03:11.348
So you can see what that looks like.

58
00:03:11.348 --> 00:03:14.460
And at this point, I have to choose
what type of document, whether or

59
00:03:14.460 --> 00:03:18.460
not I'm gonna use a template or a site
template, so I'm moving this around.

60
00:03:18.460 --> 00:03:21.060
And I'm going to choose in this
example here from the top,

61
00:03:21.060 --> 00:03:24.000
again, html, and then I get some options.

62
00:03:24.000 --> 00:03:25.660
If ever I select a different option here,

63
00:03:25.660 --> 00:03:29.720
the document type, it will change what
options are available here in the center.

64
00:03:29.720 --> 00:03:32.150
So I'm gonna choose html as an option.

65
00:03:32.150 --> 00:03:33.940
And then, from here I get to choose.

66
00:03:33.940 --> 00:03:40.520
Am I going to use a HTML 5 or
a previous version of the HTML standard.

67
00:03:42.000 --> 00:03:46.160
So we recently ratified
the World Wide Web Consortium,

68
00:03:46.160 --> 00:03:50.440
recently ratified the HTML 5 standard.

69
00:03:50.440 --> 00:03:54.712
And previous to that we were using
the 4.01 transitional with XHTML

70
00:03:54.712 --> 00:03:56.470
available as well.

71
00:03:56.470 --> 00:03:59.270
But now we've moved on to HTML 5 and
you're gonna see there are a lot of

72
00:03:59.270 --> 00:04:03.250
intuitive media ideas
that have come from that.

73
00:04:03.250 --> 00:04:04.640
So this is really good.

74
00:04:04.640 --> 00:04:07.850
Now, I can assign a document
title right here at the start and

75
00:04:07.850 --> 00:04:11.370
I can call it My sample site,
if I want to.

76
00:04:11.370 --> 00:04:15.700
And that'll give me the opportunity to
start building from that start place.

77
00:04:15.700 --> 00:04:21.609
I can also attach a cascading style sheets
to the file when I start working in this.

78
00:04:21.609 --> 00:04:23.453
But I'm not ready to do that yet and

79
00:04:23.453 --> 00:04:27.290
I'll talk about that a little bit
later as we get moved forward on this.

80
00:04:27.290 --> 00:04:31.887
We also have the bootstrap option, like I
said you can design responsive designs and

81
00:04:31.887 --> 00:04:36.291
attach your style sheets for that right
away but we'll get more into that a little

82
00:04:36.291 --> 00:04:39.034
bit later on so for now,
I'm ready to hit Create.

83
00:04:39.034 --> 00:04:42.281
Now, that I've gone through that process,

84
00:04:42.281 --> 00:04:45.970
I wanna show you real quick,
I apologize for this.

85
00:04:45.970 --> 00:04:47.971
I have the ability to go
out to the Internet and

86
00:04:47.971 --> 00:04:51.340
I wanna make sure that this is
able to go out to the Internet.

87
00:04:51.340 --> 00:04:53.310
So here's the interface
that we're working in.

88
00:04:53.310 --> 00:04:56.840
And here is basically the foundation for
everything you're going to need.

89
00:04:56.840 --> 00:04:59.650
We're gonna talk about these basic
structures where we have the design

90
00:04:59.650 --> 00:05:02.680
view and the code view, and
then we have panels left and right.

91
00:05:02.680 --> 00:05:06.370
But before I do that, I wanna jump over
to the PC side and talk about that.

92
00:05:07.660 --> 00:05:11.880
So here we are in the PC environment, and
again I'm going to start from scratch

93
00:05:11.880 --> 00:05:14.950
here, so I'm gonna go up to File and
I'm gonna choose New.

94
00:05:16.750 --> 00:05:20.360
So we're gonna get the same dialog box
that we have in the PC that we had on

95
00:05:20.360 --> 00:05:24.200
the Mac side, and I have the same
options that are available to me.

96
00:05:24.200 --> 00:05:25.850
I'm gonna choose another HTML file.

97
00:05:25.850 --> 00:05:26.740
I'm gonna do the same thing here.

98
00:05:26.740 --> 00:05:28.270
I'm gonna call it My sample site.

99
00:05:30.372 --> 00:05:31.312
If I can spell.

100
00:05:34.319 --> 00:05:38.020
>> Now, Jim, on the Windows side here,
when we make selections are these panels

101
00:05:38.020 --> 00:05:41.050
contextually sensitive like
we see on the Mac, as well?

102
00:05:41.050 --> 00:05:41.830
>> That's correct.

103
00:05:41.830 --> 00:05:47.160
As you select content within your website
you're gonna find that everything changes,

104
00:05:47.160 --> 00:05:49.260
depending on what's been selected,
so they are contextual.

105
00:05:49.260 --> 00:05:50.421
That's good.

106
00:05:50.421 --> 00:05:53.630
So we've given the title to the document.

107
00:05:53.630 --> 00:05:55.876
And we're gonna select the HTML 5 again.

108
00:05:55.876 --> 00:05:57.770
And again,
we're gonna use the same options.

109
00:05:57.770 --> 00:06:00.450
We're not gonna choose
the bootstrap at this time.

110
00:06:00.450 --> 00:06:02.890
So I'm gonna click Create.

111
00:06:02.890 --> 00:06:04.440
And what you're gonna see now,

112
00:06:04.440 --> 00:06:07.428
is that it's going to come up
with the same content sections,

113
00:06:07.428 --> 00:06:11.410
in this case it went into live mode and
some other things, we'll talk about that.

114
00:06:11.410 --> 00:06:15.238
I'm gonna be switching between the Mac
version and the PC version just so

115
00:06:15.238 --> 00:06:19.079
we can see what the differences
are because it's gonna be very glaring.

116
00:06:19.079 --> 00:06:21.441
So at this point,
I've got a document ready to go and

117
00:06:21.441 --> 00:06:24.882
you can see right away there are some
differences within the application and

118
00:06:24.882 --> 00:06:27.051
that's really what I wanna talk about for
now.

119
00:06:27.051 --> 00:06:29.894
The first thing I'd like
to bring your attention to,

120
00:06:29.894 --> 00:06:34.140
is that the file menu here, across
the top, is separate from the application.

121
00:06:34.140 --> 00:06:37.670
So if I move this down, you can see
it is separate from the application.

122
00:06:37.670 --> 00:06:43.440
And so, because of that it might give you
a little bit of a separation anxiety,

123
00:06:43.440 --> 00:06:44.570
kinda thing.

124
00:06:44.570 --> 00:06:48.280
On the PC side, however, everything
is contained within one application,

125
00:06:48.280 --> 00:06:50.670
the menu bar, everything is all together.

126
00:06:50.670 --> 00:06:52.270
So nothing is separated.

127
00:06:52.270 --> 00:06:54.850
So that's one part I wanna talk about.

128
00:06:54.850 --> 00:07:00.240
When I go to work with preferences or
I work with changing some settings

129
00:07:00.240 --> 00:07:04.620
within the background behind the machine,
in order to go to preferences on a Mac,

130
00:07:04.620 --> 00:07:08.610
I go over here to the Dreamweaver menu and
I choose Preferences.

131
00:07:08.610 --> 00:07:10.930
So this is unique to the Mac,

132
00:07:10.930 --> 00:07:14.230
the preferences that is available
is unique to the Mac this way.

133
00:07:14.230 --> 00:07:18.872
But if I go back to the PC, preferences
are always located under the Edit menu.

134
00:07:18.872 --> 00:07:22.860
So I'm gonna go over here and click on
Edit in the menu bar and then pull down.

135
00:07:22.860 --> 00:07:25.300
And then,
I have to go all the way to the bottom and

136
00:07:25.300 --> 00:07:26.690
you'll see this little triangle.

137
00:07:26.690 --> 00:07:28.320
I'll click on it until
I see the last item.

138
00:07:28.320 --> 00:07:30.690
And the last item is my preferences list.

139
00:07:30.690 --> 00:07:33.324
Now, the preferences
are the same beyond that.

140
00:07:33.324 --> 00:07:35.720
But getting there is what's different.

141
00:07:35.720 --> 00:07:38.181
So that helps out a lot.

142
00:07:38.181 --> 00:07:39.540
Let me close out of this.

143
00:07:39.540 --> 00:07:41.440
And there's one other
item I wanna talk about.

144
00:07:41.440 --> 00:07:46.376
In case you're coming from a previous
version of the Dreamweaver application,

145
00:07:46.376 --> 00:07:49.207
maybe Creative Suite 6 or
Creative Suite 5,

146
00:07:49.207 --> 00:07:52.039
the view on the Mac was
a little bit different,

147
00:07:52.039 --> 00:07:56.918
in the sense that I would go to Window and
I could choose application frame here.

148
00:07:56.918 --> 00:08:00.499
So what happens is,
all of the panels now are floating and

149
00:08:00.499 --> 00:08:04.909
they can be manipulated and
moved Moved independently of each other.

150
00:08:04.909 --> 00:08:09.660
Now this was unique to the Mac, did not
have this flexibility on the PC side.

151
00:08:09.660 --> 00:08:12.510
So there is no applications
frame that's available.

152
00:08:12.510 --> 00:08:15.370
And if I want to reset everything back,
I go back up to Window and

153
00:08:15.370 --> 00:08:19.520
I choose Application Frame,
I check that, and it should flow back.

154
00:08:19.520 --> 00:08:22.730
Now you'll note here that this
panel is not flowing back to

155
00:08:22.730 --> 00:08:25.660
this part on the right, and
I'm gonna to dock it just for a moment.

156
00:08:25.660 --> 00:08:27.360
So let's dock back.

157
00:08:27.360 --> 00:08:30.020
If I go here back to the PC side, and

158
00:08:30.020 --> 00:08:33.850
I click on window,
there is no application painting option.

159
00:08:33.850 --> 00:08:38.100
So this is one of the major
differences within

160
00:08:38.100 --> 00:08:41.260
the Windows version in
comparison to the Mac version.

161
00:08:41.260 --> 00:08:46.110
Now, I live in the Mac world, so
I spent a lot of time on the Mac version.

162
00:08:46.110 --> 00:08:48.920
But I'd like to work with
the configuration and I'll configure on

163
00:08:48.920 --> 00:08:53.290
both sides so that you can see
there's flexibility across both apps.

164
00:08:53.290 --> 00:08:55.910
So there's not too much
of a difference there.

165
00:08:55.910 --> 00:09:02.000
But I will spend most of my time
building a webpage on the Mac version.

166
00:09:03.210 --> 00:09:08.410
So, to start, we talk about
the menu bar here across the top.

167
00:09:08.410 --> 00:09:09.820
So, we talked about the menu bar and

168
00:09:09.820 --> 00:09:11.470
the fact that it's separate
from the application, but

169
00:09:11.470 --> 00:09:14.100
below that it's called
the application bar.

170
00:09:14.100 --> 00:09:16.500
So on the Mac there's
not a lot going on here.

171
00:09:16.500 --> 00:09:19.710
The application bar is this section
right here with those default, and

172
00:09:19.710 --> 00:09:27.740
then I can synchronize between my Creative
Cloud services and the Adobe Application.

173
00:09:27.740 --> 00:09:31.860
When I go back to the PC side,
okay, here's my menu bar.

174
00:09:31.860 --> 00:09:35.090
But all the way to the right
is the Application bar, so

175
00:09:35.090 --> 00:09:37.490
basically it's all connected into one,
okay?

176
00:09:37.490 --> 00:09:40.880
And I still have the ability to chose
a workspace and change that up, and

177
00:09:40.880 --> 00:09:42.200
I have the ability to sync.

178
00:09:42.200 --> 00:09:44.460
And you can see right now it's
got a little exclamation point,

179
00:09:44.460 --> 00:09:47.600
which means that I haven't synchronized
in this particular application.

180
00:09:49.630 --> 00:09:54.300
Now, where it says default,
I call that a work space

181
00:09:54.300 --> 00:09:57.300
because you might be sharing your computer
with other people, or you might want to

182
00:09:57.300 --> 00:10:00.629
change the work space depending on what
your work flow is going to be like.

183
00:10:01.730 --> 00:10:02.860
And I will tell you,

184
00:10:02.860 --> 00:10:07.370
I like to change my environment to
suit the workflow that I enjoy.

185
00:10:07.370 --> 00:10:10.620
And I've enjoyed all the way back to CS5.

186
00:10:10.620 --> 00:10:14.900
So, what you're gonna see me do today is
to learn how to manipulate the panels.

187
00:10:14.900 --> 00:10:20.120
But at the same The same time I'm going
to teach you the workflow that I use.

188
00:10:20.120 --> 00:10:23.070
So we are using the default workspace and

189
00:10:23.070 --> 00:10:25.520
basically configures all
the panels over here on the right.

190
00:10:25.520 --> 00:10:31.120
And in this case I can see split view
between my design and my code, okay.

191
00:10:31.120 --> 00:10:34.600
What I'd like to do is I would like
to move some of these panels around.

192
00:10:34.600 --> 00:10:37.450
So for example I have the files
panel over here and there's a tab.

193
00:10:37.450 --> 00:10:42.490
I'm gonna click on this tab and
I'm gonna left click and drag down

194
00:10:42.490 --> 00:10:48.110
until I dock it in here with the document
argent model and the assets panel.

195
00:10:48.110 --> 00:10:48.930
And what I'm looking for

196
00:10:48.930 --> 00:10:52.770
here is a blue highlight that
comes around the entire box.

197
00:10:52.770 --> 00:10:56.070
Once that blue highlight is there,
it shows me that I'm ready to put this in

198
00:10:56.070 --> 00:10:58.680
the same space as the rest
of the tabs that are there.

199
00:10:58.680 --> 00:11:01.790
So when I let go,
it should dock that information together.

200
00:11:01.790 --> 00:11:02.330
So there it is.

201
00:11:02.330 --> 00:11:06.540
So there's the DOM, there's the ASF panel,
and then there's the files panel.

202
00:11:06.540 --> 00:11:10.570
Now, I do like the files panel
to be by predominant items,

203
00:11:10.570 --> 00:11:12.700
so I'm going to move
files here to the left.

204
00:11:12.700 --> 00:11:14.350
And so now it's Files, DOM, Assets.

205
00:11:14.350 --> 00:11:17.120
So you can rearrange the tabs
within that group as well.

206
00:11:17.120 --> 00:11:19.680
So you're not trapped with that.

207
00:11:19.680 --> 00:11:23.280
Now I maximize this by double-clicking,
so I can double-click, for example,

208
00:11:23.280 --> 00:11:25.250
CC Libraries and expand that back down.

209
00:11:26.250 --> 00:11:27.640
And here it is.

210
00:11:27.640 --> 00:11:33.580
Now Insert Insert is one that I like
to move above my untitled document.

211
00:11:33.580 --> 00:11:36.890
I'm currently working untitled document,
because that's what I created earlier.

212
00:11:36.890 --> 00:11:38.300
I'd like to move that above there.

213
00:11:38.300 --> 00:11:42.880
So I'm gonna pull that out, make it float,
this is known as a floating panel.

214
00:11:42.880 --> 00:11:46.540
You can see all the options that are
available now I'm going to grab this dark

215
00:11:46.540 --> 00:11:50.760
bar, and I'm going to pull it to
the top until I see a blue highlight.

216
00:11:50.760 --> 00:11:53.690
That blue highlight tells me that that's
where I'm going to put this new panel.

217
00:11:53.690 --> 00:11:59.520
And when I release, I now have the
insertion panel up here at the top, okay?

218
00:11:59.520 --> 00:12:01.420
So I have all the options
that are available to me.

219
00:12:01.420 --> 00:12:05.359
And this is the HTML section,
which lets me add HTML content.

220
00:12:06.480 --> 00:12:10.780
So at this point, I have the Files
panel with my document object model and

221
00:12:10.780 --> 00:12:11.890
my assets.

222
00:12:11.890 --> 00:12:13.520
I have the insert panel here at the top.

223
00:12:13.520 --> 00:12:16.230
And there's one more panel that
I would like to configure and

224
00:12:16.230 --> 00:12:17.090
place down at the bottom.

225
00:12:17.090 --> 00:12:19.410
And that's the Properties panel.

226
00:12:19.410 --> 00:12:21.930
The Properties panel is
currently not available.

227
00:12:21.930 --> 00:12:24.220
But whenever you see that
there's a panel missing,

228
00:12:24.220 --> 00:12:28.770
you can always bring a panel back
out by going to the Window menu.

229
00:12:28.770 --> 00:12:32.430
So I'm gonna go up here to
the Window menu bar, choose that and

230
00:12:32.430 --> 00:12:35.740
in the list notice properties is
not checked but insert is checked,

231
00:12:35.740 --> 00:12:37.730
files is checked and
applications framed is checked.

232
00:12:37.730 --> 00:12:40.140
So those are the active items right now.

233
00:12:40.140 --> 00:12:42.300
So I'm gonna check properties and

234
00:12:42.300 --> 00:12:47.040
it will appear as a floating panel and I'm
gonna dock it right here at the bottom, so

235
00:12:47.040 --> 00:12:49.370
that way I have the ability to
access that whenever I need to.

236
00:12:49.370 --> 00:12:53.560
Now, it does take up real estate for
the work I need to do.

237
00:12:53.560 --> 00:12:56.260
But again, if don't want to
focus on the split view here,

238
00:12:56.260 --> 00:12:59.300
I can say just show me the design or
just show me the code.

239
00:12:59.300 --> 00:13:01.950
So I have the flexibility
to change that as well.

240
00:13:01.950 --> 00:13:05.570
Okay, so at this point I've rearranged my

241
00:13:06.690 --> 00:13:10.940
panels the way I like them and
the way that the work flow works for me.

242
00:13:10.940 --> 00:13:16.750
So I'm going to now save that as preset
that I can use over and over again.

243
00:13:16.750 --> 00:13:20.300
>> Jim, with these customizations, is this
something that pretty much anybody can do?

244
00:13:20.300 --> 00:13:24.290
Not really a one size fits all but
how you want your workspace,

245
00:13:24.290 --> 00:13:25.800
what makes you productive.

246
00:13:25.800 --> 00:13:29.630
You can configure it that way,
and you can save it.

247
00:13:29.630 --> 00:13:33.080
I can only imagine you could load
it back up after the fact as well.

248
00:13:33.080 --> 00:13:35.150
>> That is a very good question, Wes, and

249
00:13:35.150 --> 00:13:37.570
I've had students ask me that
same question every time.

250
00:13:37.570 --> 00:13:41.290
They say hey, can you give me that
orientation that you did before?

251
00:13:41.290 --> 00:13:44.420
And I always come back to the point that
they can configure it in whatever way

252
00:13:44.420 --> 00:13:45.020
they want.

253
00:13:45.020 --> 00:13:46.870
It's complete flexibility.

254
00:13:46.870 --> 00:13:49.790
Once you save it inside of the workspace,

255
00:13:49.790 --> 00:13:53.040
you will have access to use
that same workspace every time.

256
00:13:53.040 --> 00:13:55.070
You can switch between workspaces, but

257
00:13:55.070 --> 00:13:57.300
you can always come back to
the one that you've saved.

258
00:13:57.300 --> 00:14:00.070
So that's a very good question and
we're gonna do that now.

259
00:14:00.070 --> 00:14:03.800
So if we go back to my workspace here and
I go to where it says default.

260
00:14:03.800 --> 00:14:05.370
There's a little pull down.

261
00:14:05.370 --> 00:14:06.470
If I click on that pull-down,

262
00:14:06.470 --> 00:14:09.990
you'll see that there's some items that
have already been built for us by Adobe.

263
00:14:09.990 --> 00:14:12.650
So we have Beginner, Code,
Design, and Abstract.

264
00:14:12.650 --> 00:14:14.020
So for example if I click on Beginner,

265
00:14:14.020 --> 00:14:16.420
this would give me sort
of a beginner layout.

266
00:14:16.420 --> 00:14:18.310
Okay, and it will rearrange things.

267
00:14:18.310 --> 00:14:21.820
Now I should have saved before I did this
because now I'm going to have to reset,

268
00:14:21.820 --> 00:14:25.400
but at this point in time it's
rearranged all my panels.

269
00:14:25.400 --> 00:14:28.230
I did leave the properties panel
down here, which is great, but

270
00:14:28.230 --> 00:14:31.170
it moved insert and
files down here to the top.

271
00:14:31.170 --> 00:14:35.390
If I go back to code view, for example,
now the emphasis is going to be on writing

272
00:14:35.390 --> 00:14:39.060
code, and because of that it puts it
right there on the right-hand side, and

273
00:14:39.060 --> 00:14:43.310
now your panels are relegated to
the left of the application, okay.

274
00:14:43.310 --> 00:14:46.190
So again, just a different workflow
that you might have within

275
00:14:46.190 --> 00:14:47.800
your environment that you wanna use.

276
00:14:47.800 --> 00:14:51.230
If I chose design for example,
now design is going to be the focus, so

277
00:14:51.230 --> 00:14:55.410
now we come out with our CSS designer,
or our cascading style sheets designer.

278
00:14:55.410 --> 00:14:58.590
Now code is still available but
I can switch it over to design here and

279
00:14:58.590 --> 00:14:59.930
I can focus on that.

280
00:14:59.930 --> 00:15:02.630
So these are options that
are available for us and

281
00:15:02.630 --> 00:15:05.840
these are presets that
Adobe has created for us.

282
00:15:05.840 --> 00:15:09.150
So what I'd like to do again is I'm
gonna reset it back to the default.

283
00:15:10.390 --> 00:15:13.350
Now it should remember how
I configured the default.

284
00:15:13.350 --> 00:15:15.220
So Wes, this is important.

285
00:15:15.220 --> 00:15:18.820
Look at how everything that I had before,
remember I told you I forgot to save and

286
00:15:18.820 --> 00:15:19.660
that could be a problem?

287
00:15:19.660 --> 00:15:21.240
>> That's right.
>> Not an issue.

288
00:15:21.240 --> 00:15:23.750
It remembered it for
the default workspace,

289
00:15:23.750 --> 00:15:26.340
it kept everything exactly
the way I had it set up.

290
00:15:26.340 --> 00:15:29.760
Now granted, I might want to,
at some point,

291
00:15:29.760 --> 00:15:34.070
To reset the default work space so that
way it starts from the beginning again.

292
00:15:34.070 --> 00:15:37.240
So I'm gonna need to save this work
space the way it is in order for

293
00:15:37.240 --> 00:15:39.450
me to have that layout
configured that way.

294
00:15:39.450 --> 00:15:43.810
So I'm gonna go up here to default and
I'm gonna say new work space.

295
00:15:43.810 --> 00:15:45.530
So I'm gonna click new work space.

296
00:15:45.530 --> 00:15:50.867
And I wanna call James Playground, okay.

297
00:15:50.867 --> 00:15:53.523
So James Playground when I click OK.

298
00:15:53.523 --> 00:15:57.244
Now those settings are specific
to that work space.

299
00:15:57.244 --> 00:15:59.904
When I load Dreamweaver moving forward,

300
00:15:59.904 --> 00:16:04.850
it will always have this configuration,
until I make a change at some point.

301
00:16:04.850 --> 00:16:07.560
And remember,
the changes are saved immediately.

302
00:16:07.560 --> 00:16:13.180
If I want to, I could go back to Default
and now I can say Reset Default.

303
00:16:13.180 --> 00:16:15.384
So if I come over here and
I say Reset Default,

304
00:16:15.384 --> 00:16:18.690
it will literally configure it back
to the way it was at the beginning

305
00:16:18.690 --> 00:16:20.966
where the Insert panel
is no longer at the top.

306
00:16:20.966 --> 00:16:24.460
The Properties panel is no longer
at the bottom, and all my files and

307
00:16:24.460 --> 00:16:27.720
inserts here are in the same
grouping on the upper left corner.

308
00:16:29.070 --> 00:16:32.220
So I want to go back Jim's Playground,
it's right here at the top,

309
00:16:32.220 --> 00:16:36.300
I click on it, and I'm configured
back to the result I had before.

310
00:16:36.300 --> 00:16:39.280
So it will remember if I close
out of Dreamweaver, reload it,

311
00:16:39.280 --> 00:16:42.495
it will remember that Jim's Playground
is a configuration that I've got set and

312
00:16:42.495 --> 00:16:44.300
it'll revert me back to this.

313
00:16:44.300 --> 00:16:47.428
So I will always have access to my tools,
exactly this way.

314
00:16:47.428 --> 00:16:52.050
>> Now, Jim, with the individual panels,
is there any way that we can resize them,

315
00:16:52.050 --> 00:16:54.910
can we minimize them,
if we decide that we want them but

316
00:16:54.910 --> 00:16:57.040
maybe we don't currently
want them in our workspace?

317
00:16:57.040 --> 00:16:59.990
>> That's a very good question and
that's absolutely correct.

318
00:16:59.990 --> 00:17:03.340
So for example here,
the CC Libraries panel.

319
00:17:03.340 --> 00:17:05.510
CC Libraries I might use later on.

320
00:17:05.510 --> 00:17:07.250
It's Creative Cloud Libraries.

321
00:17:07.250 --> 00:17:09.330
Basically, what we're doing
with the CC Libraries,

322
00:17:09.330 --> 00:17:13.300
Creative Cloud, we're connecting to the
cloud services provided to you by Adobe.

323
00:17:13.300 --> 00:17:14.440
When you purchase the software,

324
00:17:14.440 --> 00:17:19.660
you also get, I think it's 5 to 20
gigabytes of storage space in the cloud.

325
00:17:19.660 --> 00:17:24.270
And you can add your assets to the cloud
services but you also get things back.

326
00:17:24.270 --> 00:17:27.560
You get fonts that you can use,
there's a font kit available, and

327
00:17:27.560 --> 00:17:29.690
then there's some assets
that they provide you.

328
00:17:29.690 --> 00:17:31.927
So if there are any assets that
you have saved for yourself,

329
00:17:31.927 --> 00:17:35.080
they'll be listed here, so it'll
connect to the Internet and find that.

330
00:17:35.080 --> 00:17:37.870
Well, I'm not using it right now,
so I might wanna move that out.

331
00:17:37.870 --> 00:17:41.443
So if I grab the tab CC Libraries,
I can pull that out and

332
00:17:41.443 --> 00:17:43.167
make it a floating panel.

333
00:17:43.167 --> 00:17:47.451
Or if I'd prefer, I can come over here
to the Panel Options Menu in the upper

334
00:17:47.451 --> 00:17:51.940
right corner, I can select that and
I can tell it to Close that item.

335
00:17:51.940 --> 00:17:54.121
Okay, so
if I close that item it goes away.

336
00:17:54.121 --> 00:17:58.007
Now, don't fret because you can
always go back to the Window menu and

337
00:17:58.007 --> 00:17:59.890
you can bring it back at any time.

338
00:17:59.890 --> 00:18:04.551
So any items that you have that you might
wanna bring back, you can just click on.

339
00:18:04.551 --> 00:18:07.190
So CC Libraries is right here
in the middle of the list.

340
00:18:07.190 --> 00:18:11.420
If I click on it, it will bring it
back and there we go, it's loading.

341
00:18:12.720 --> 00:18:14.560
The surf ball of doom.

342
00:18:15.950 --> 00:18:17.197
>> Gotta love the floating pinwheel.

343
00:18:17.197 --> 00:18:18.185
>> [LAUGH] Yes.
>> [LAUGH]

344
00:18:18.185 --> 00:18:18.915
>> That's correct.

345
00:18:18.915 --> 00:18:20.755
And there it is,
floating back in the center.

346
00:18:20.755 --> 00:18:22.245
And the reason why it's taking a while,

347
00:18:22.245 --> 00:18:24.755
because its trying to connect
to the Internet to find

348
00:18:24.755 --> 00:18:26.695
the CC Libraries that I
might have available to me.

349
00:18:26.695 --> 00:18:29.295
So it actually did a refresh there,
so that's good.

350
00:18:29.295 --> 00:18:32.831
But I did wanna close that out, so I can
also click the X here in the upper left

351
00:18:32.831 --> 00:18:35.772
corner and close it out just like
you would close out a window.

352
00:18:35.772 --> 00:18:40.270
Okay, so at this point I have
CC Designer and Snippets.

353
00:18:40.270 --> 00:18:43.430
I have no problem with Snippets and
I have no problem with CC Designer.

354
00:18:43.430 --> 00:18:47.530
As a matter of fact Snippets has some code
that you can grab that has been written by

355
00:18:47.530 --> 00:18:51.920
Adobe and you can write code yourself and
reuse it over and over again.

356
00:18:51.920 --> 00:18:54.440
But the CC Designer is
one of those that if you

357
00:18:54.440 --> 00:18:58.660
resize this panel here on the right
it will give you more options.

358
00:18:58.660 --> 00:19:02.279
So, for example, notice I have Sources,
Media, Selectors, Properties.

359
00:19:02.279 --> 00:19:07.031
Okay, if I resize this by coming over here
and seeing the double arrows like you

360
00:19:07.031 --> 00:19:11.063
do to resize anything, if I resize
this by dragging it to the left,

361
00:19:11.063 --> 00:19:16.110
you're gonna see that Properties
should eventually jump to the right.

362
00:19:16.110 --> 00:19:19.870
So, resizing in this example,
is very useful,

363
00:19:19.870 --> 00:19:23.270
because you can actually
gain more workflow.

364
00:19:23.270 --> 00:19:26.740
It's a better workflow to work with
your properties in a second column,

365
00:19:26.740 --> 00:19:29.240
than it is to be underneath Selectors,
because now

366
00:19:29.240 --> 00:19:33.890
I can see what properties I might want to
assign to the items that I'm working with.

367
00:19:33.890 --> 00:19:35.590
So that's a really good question.

368
00:19:35.590 --> 00:19:36.820
Now, I can minimize this.

369
00:19:36.820 --> 00:19:38.260
I can make it so it's not even showing.

370
00:19:38.260 --> 00:19:42.050
Maybe I wanna focus on my code,
or I wanna focus on the design.

371
00:19:42.050 --> 00:19:46.350
So I can come over here in the upper
right-hand corner of these panels and

372
00:19:46.350 --> 00:19:49.300
hit these double chevrons, okay?

373
00:19:49.300 --> 00:19:52.570
So these double arrows, I hit that,
it will collapse it down.

374
00:19:52.570 --> 00:19:55.170
And I didn't click on it,
I clicked on the Menu, here it is.

375
00:19:55.170 --> 00:19:56.700
Collapse to icons.

376
00:19:56.700 --> 00:19:59.410
So here I've got it so
it's got the text and icons.

377
00:19:59.410 --> 00:20:01.936
And with the text and icons I can
tell what those icons represent.

378
00:20:01.936 --> 00:20:04.395
But I can even drag it
further to the right and

379
00:20:04.395 --> 00:20:07.700
make it even smaller to
where it's just the icons.

380
00:20:07.700 --> 00:20:11.180
If I'm familiar enough to know
what those icons represent

381
00:20:11.180 --> 00:20:13.540
then I don't need the text
to tell me what it is.

382
00:20:13.540 --> 00:20:15.070
And so we have that flexibility.

383
00:20:15.070 --> 00:20:19.850
Now you can see I have a lot of room
in this area here to write code and

384
00:20:19.850 --> 00:20:22.560
also to see my design and
see how things are working out.

385
00:20:24.260 --> 00:20:31.230
Now, when I do collapse it down, however,
I click on the item and it expands out.

386
00:20:31.230 --> 00:20:32.820
But that's temporary, right?

387
00:20:32.820 --> 00:20:36.890
Cuz I can click back on the double
chevrons and collapse it down again.

388
00:20:36.890 --> 00:20:41.600
So I can configure this
by resizing the panels,

389
00:20:41.600 --> 00:20:46.110
making them smaller or larger,
and I can actually benefit

390
00:20:46.110 --> 00:20:50.320
by resizing because I could get
more of my design or coding space.

391
00:20:50.320 --> 00:20:54.800
Or, I can get more information
within the panel itself.

392
00:20:54.800 --> 00:20:56.630
And that's really important.

393
00:20:56.630 --> 00:20:58.110
So good question.

394
00:20:58.110 --> 00:20:59.300
I am gonna expand this out.

395
00:20:59.300 --> 00:20:59.810
Or, guess what?

396
00:20:59.810 --> 00:21:03.530
I'm gonna go back here and
tell it to reset Jim's Playground.

397
00:21:03.530 --> 00:21:06.840
And that should expand it back out for
me and make it the size it was before.

398
00:21:06.840 --> 00:21:10.717
>> Now, Jim, that seems like somebody
like me that maybe is new to Dreamweaver,

399
00:21:10.717 --> 00:21:13.948
that if [LAUGH] I get in there and
I configure things, completely,

400
00:21:13.948 --> 00:21:15.860
just completely hose the workspace.

401
00:21:15.860 --> 00:21:18.050
And I'm like,
I don't really have much workspace.

402
00:21:18.050 --> 00:21:19.500
I've got work, but no more space.

403
00:21:19.500 --> 00:21:20.730
I can reset things, right?

404
00:21:20.730 --> 00:21:23.411
>> Absolutely,
I have heard of that many times.

405
00:21:23.411 --> 00:21:27.150
I have so many panels open and
I can't see what I'm trying to do.

406
00:21:27.150 --> 00:21:27.823
What can I do?

407
00:21:27.823 --> 00:21:31.048
You just go back and you reset
the workspace back to what it was, and

408
00:21:31.048 --> 00:21:32.800
the panels that you had open.

409
00:21:32.800 --> 00:21:37.780
Because you can open as many
panels as are available here and

410
00:21:37.780 --> 00:21:41.010
you can get it to become so
busy that you can't see

411
00:21:41.010 --> 00:21:44.430
anything that you're doing anymore and
that might cause problems.

412
00:21:44.430 --> 00:21:48.860
I mean, even some of these panels
have sub-panels within them.

413
00:21:48.860 --> 00:21:50.360
So there's so many panels going on.

414
00:21:50.360 --> 00:21:52.280
And you might have moved these around.

415
00:21:52.280 --> 00:21:54.200
And so
you could see what's going on in there.

416
00:21:54.200 --> 00:21:57.110
But at any time you can hit that Reset and
it'll solve the problem.

417
00:21:57.110 --> 00:22:00.000
You're absolutely right,
so good point there.

418
00:22:00.000 --> 00:22:01.770
Okay, fantastic.

419
00:22:01.770 --> 00:22:04.990
Now, with that said,
I'd like to go over to the PC side,

00:22:04.990 --> 00:22:06.840

421
00:22:06.840 --> 00:22:09.126
So if I go back to my PC side here.

422
00:22:09.126 --> 00:22:12.533
Goodness, Windows Users Parallels is

423
00:22:12.533 --> 00:22:18.570
Okay, so I have the same
configuration here, I'm on Default.

00:22:18.570 --> 00:22:20.660
There is no Jim's workspace, right,

00:22:20.660 --> 00:22:22.030
because I'm working on

But I still have the presets
that Adobe has created for

00:22:24.870 --> 00:22:27.600

00:22:27.600 --> 00:22:33.578
So if I wanted to, I could start moving my

429
00:22:33.578 --> 00:22:39.215
reposition them where I like them to be,

430
00:22:39.215 --> 00:22:45.175
And that should provide me
a view of what I'm trying to do.

431
00:22:45.175 --> 00:22:46.273
Okay, sorry.

432
00:22:46.273 --> 00:22:50.940
I'm gonna go to here, there we go, okay.

00:22:50.940 --> 00:22:53.460
And I guess Assets was also down here.

00:22:53.460 --> 00:22:56.192
Okay, so we have all of these items.

00:22:58.638 --> 00:23:03.750
Okay, and at this point,

00:23:03.750 --> 00:23:06.290

Come over here, save it.

00:23:35.492 --> 00:23:37.190

So, similar configuration.

447
00:23:40.742 --> 00:23:43.600
And there's my code, just like before,
and we're good to go.

448
00:23:43.600 --> 00:23:45.110
>> And
I can see where that would come in handy,

449
00:23:45.110 --> 00:23:48.150
Jim, if you're moving between
two different platforms.

450
00:23:48.150 --> 00:23:51.000
Maybe you got a work computer that's
got Windows but you come home,

451
00:23:51.000 --> 00:23:52.780
maybe you're using your Mac at home.

452
00:23:52.780 --> 00:23:57.137
Where you can kinda have some consistency,
if it will be, in the user interface,

453
00:23:57.137 --> 00:23:59.220
user experience, right?

454
00:23:59.220 --> 00:24:03.990
>> That's absolutely correct, the point of
a workspace is to have that consistency so

455
00:24:03.990 --> 00:24:07.570
theres familiarity with
where things are located and

456
00:24:07.570 --> 00:24:09.310
you'll be able to find it much easier.

457
00:24:09.310 --> 00:24:13.925
This is a workflow that I've used since I
started using Dreamweaver back in 1997,

458
00:24:13.925 --> 00:24:18.345
because that's how the arrangement was,
the Insert panel was always on the top and

459
00:24:18.345 --> 00:24:20.579
the Properties was always at the bottom.

460
00:24:20.579 --> 00:24:25.427
So a lot of these are happening
because of the fact that I'm just so

461
00:24:25.427 --> 00:24:29.680
used to it it's become routine for
me, and I enjoy that.

462
00:24:29.680 --> 00:24:30.900
But you're absolutely right.

463
00:24:30.900 --> 00:24:33.220
If you move from one
workstation to another,

464
00:24:33.220 --> 00:24:37.310
the workspace will give you that
consistency and it'll help you out.

465
00:24:37.310 --> 00:24:38.690
Good questions.

466
00:24:38.690 --> 00:24:39.720
Okay, fantastic.

467
00:24:39.720 --> 00:24:44.490
So we've got the workspace,
we can move our panels around,

468
00:24:44.490 --> 00:24:47.310
we can make them float,
we can close them down individually.

469
00:24:47.310 --> 00:24:51.260
And we can save the workspace so
that way we can use it in the future and

470
00:24:51.260 --> 00:24:56.810
you can make it so that way, you have
this reusable space for you every time.

471
00:24:56.810 --> 00:25:00.430
>> All right, thank you, Jim,
for a good introduction there.

472
00:25:00.430 --> 00:25:03.860
But it does look like we're gonna come
to the end of another episode here, but

473
00:25:03.860 --> 00:25:06.350
before we do that,
do you have other additional words?

474
00:25:06.350 --> 00:25:10.440
>> Yeah, the point of
discussion is that I would like

475
00:25:10.440 --> 00:25:13.380
to say that if you feel comfortable in
the environment that you're working with,

476
00:25:13.380 --> 00:25:17.840
these tools will really help benefit you,
and configuring your workspace,

477
00:25:17.840 --> 00:25:22.230
configuring the layout of everything,
is really basically for comfort.

478
00:25:22.230 --> 00:25:24.010
>> And it's basically to provide you,

479
00:25:24.010 --> 00:25:28.600
the user, a space that you're gonna
wanna work in and always come back to.

480
00:25:28.600 --> 00:25:31.370
>> All right, well, Jim,
we appreciate your information on that and

481
00:25:31.370 --> 00:25:33.050
we do appreciate you, the viewer.

482
00:25:33.050 --> 00:25:35.107
We're gonna go ahead and
sign out here at ITProTV.

483
00:25:35.107 --> 00:25:37.148
I've been your host Wes Bryan.

484
00:25:37.148 --> 00:25:37.962
>> And I'm Jim Searles.

485
00:25:37.962 --> 00:25:40.250
>> And we'll see you next time.

486
00:25:40.250 --> 00:25:48.400
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate how to create a new site inside of DreamWeaver. They explore configuring appropriate folders for all site files, version control and the Files panel. They talk about naming conventions to organize content, tips to help make the user more productive and efficient.
episodes.title: Creating a Site in Dreamweaver

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim show the viewer how to create a new page. They discuss HTML characteristics such as tags, elements, attributes and values. They explain HTML structure such as the header, body and doctype. They explore using HTLM5 structure such as headers, navs, mains, sections, articles and footers.
episodes.title: Creating a Page in Dreamweaver

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss styling with Cascading Style Sheets. They talk about the three different styles including internal/embedded, external and inline. They introduce selectors such as classes, IDs and tags and well as the CSS Designer panel.
episodes.title: Styling with CSS

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim discuss the characteristics of common images uses inside of websites today. They talk look at the Graphic Interchange Format, Joint Photographic Experts Group and the Portable Network Graphic file formats and their usages. They demonstrate how to insert an image within the website and the Assets Panel.
episodes.title: Inserting Images

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim take a look at inserting links within the website. They discuss link types such as internal, external, incoming as well as their purpose when using them. They look at link concepts such as absolute paths, document-relative paths and site root-relative paths.
episodes.title: Inserting Links

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate inserting multimedia files into the website. They explain the different audio file types such as MP3, OGG and WAV as well as browser compatibility for these files. They discuss different video files MP4, OGG, WebM and likewise browser compatibility for these files.
episodes.title: Inserting Multimedia Files

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate to the viewer how to create, save and use templates. They discuss regions like editable regions, repeating regions and optional regions. They also take a look at tables and talk about the common usage for them.
episodes.title: Working with Templates and Tables

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim introduce creating forms. They explain the properties of forms like form ID, action, method, target, enctype and class. They also look at various form elements such as text fields, hidden fields, textarea, checkbox groups and more.
episodes.title: Creating Forms

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim walk through several design principles to guide the viewer through best practices such as,knowing who you are design to, copyright and infringement concerns and more.
episodes.title: Principles of Web Design

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Jim demonstrate how to push the website into production by publishing it. They look at some of the tools that can be used to validate the website, perform link checking and spelling checker.
episodes.title: Publishing Your Site
